Package io.jans.casa.ui

Class CustomDateConverter

java.lang.Object
io.jans.casa.ui.CustomDateConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.zkoss.bind.Converter
public class CustomDateConverter extends Object implements org.zkoss.bind.Converter
This class is a custom ZK converter employed to display dates appropriately according to user location. It uses the time offset with respect to UTC time and a formatting pattern supplied to show dates. It does not implement String to Date conversion.
Author:
jgomer

  • Method Details

    • coerceToUi

      public Object coerceToUi(Object val, org.zkoss.zk.ui.Component comp, org.zkoss.bind.BindContext ctx)
      This method is called when conversion (Date to String) is taking placing in .zul templates.
      Specified by:
      coerceToUi in interface org.zkoss.bind.Converter
      Parameters:
      val - An object representing a date, namely a java.util.Date or a long value (milliseconds from the epoch)
      comp - The UI component associated to this converstion
      ctx - Binding context. It holds the conversion arguments: "format" and "offset" are used here
      Returns:
      A string with the date properly formatted or null if val parameter is not a valid date

    • coerceToBean

      public Object coerceToBean(Object val, org.zkoss.zk.ui.Component comp, org.zkoss.bind.BindContext ctx)
      This method is called when converting String to Date.
      Specified by:
      coerceToBean in interface org.zkoss.bind.Converter
      Parameters:
      val - A date in string form
      comp - Associated component
      ctx - Bind context for associate Binding and extra parameter (e.g. format)
      Returns:
      null (conversion not implemented)
